page.title: 11Hospital provision,Liskeard
page.content: Passmore Edwards,one of two hospitals in Liskeard,was built in 1895 but has since been considerably modernised and extended.It has a Casualty Unit,an operating theatre,an X-ray department and an out-patients section.A new physiotherapy unit is under construction.There is a 7-bed male ward,a 7-bed female ward and 5 single rooms.The hospital serves Liskeard and the surrounding villages and works closely with the Social Services. Present staffing is a Senior Nursing Officer,24 nurses,6 cleaners,2 cooks,1 porter,3 office staff,1 radiographer and 1 physiotherapist.Plymouth consultant surgeons operate here on Tuesday mornings and use local anaethetists.Plymouth Area Health Authority provides all necessary dressings,medicines and laundry.Food is cooked on the premises.
